DOC.brief_title: A Randomized Double-Blind Placebo Controlled Trial Determine Status Post Knee Chondroplasty Patients Administered Theramine Versus Placebo Addition Post Surgery Analgesics
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed knee pain require chondroplasty knee arthroscopic surgery . Men nonpregnant , nonlactating woman age 18 age 75 , able read , understand sign Englishlanguage inform consent . If use psychoactive medication might analgesic effect , ( i.e . antidepressant anticonsultants ) , treatment must stable least three ( 3 ) month prior study . For men woman childbearing potential , must willing use adequate contraception pregnant impregnate partner entire time study . Must willing commit clinical visit studyrelated procedure . Require use narcotic pain relief . Patients significant neurologic impairment , diagnose screen physical examination . Patients fluent English . Patients currently involve Workman 's Compensation case related procedure . Receipt oral intramuscular softtissue injection corticosteroid within one ( 1 ) month prior screen . History substance abuse . History malignancy , basal squamous cell skin within last 5 year . Tibial plateau fracture within 6 month prior surgery .
